description: From im- (“in”) +‎ paste. Compare Italian impastare, Old French empaster.

verbs.description: impaste (third-person singular simple present impastes, present participle impasting, simple past and past participle impasted)

entries.meaning: (transitive, archaic) To knead; to make into paste; to concrete.
(art) To lay colours thickly on canvas by the impasto technique.
